docna.cdata!:
Equatorial Guinea - Technical Assistance
            Project : Credit 1489 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Equatorial Guinea - Technical
            Assistance Project : Credit 1489 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Project will
            provide: (a) five long-term resident specialists in the
            sectors of economic planning, agriculture, forestry, mining,
            and education; and (b) short-term consultants, including an
            architect/specialist in school construction, a training
            specialist, and a public debt specialist. It will also (c)
            provide training or on-the-job experience abroad for
            Equato-Guinean nationals; (d) housing, vehicles, and
            associated operating and maintenance costs for the resident
            experts; and (e) the services of a locally recruited
            Administrative Officer to handle details of project
            management and administration. Furthermore, funds are to be
            allocated for; (f) office equipment and supplies, local
            support staff, and other operating costs for project
            administration; and (g) studies, further short-term
            consultants' services, and other project-related
            activities to be identified during project implementation.
